data.title: » Olympic Fever Hits Syracuse
data.meta_description: A service of the Broadcast & Digital Journalism Students at Syracuse University
data.text:
(ANC)

OLYMPIC FEVER HAS HIT SYRACUSE AND NCC’S ASHA BREEDLOVE HAS MORE ON HOW THIS CITY IS FEELING PATROTIC.

ASHA BREEDLOVE,REPORTER:FOR THE LAST WEEK ALL EYES HAVE BEEN ON THE OLYMPICS. TOP ATHLETES FROM ACROSS THE NATION GO OUT THERE PUTTING THEIR NAMES, REPUTATIONS, BUT MOST IMPORTANTLY THE COUNTRY ON THIER BACKS. PRE-COLLEGE STUDENT GRAYSON RUPP SAYS, SEEING TEAM USA IN THE OPENING CEREMONY MADE HIM FEEL PROUD OF HIS COUNTRY.

GRAYSON RUPP INTERVIEWEE: THAT PHOTO OF LEBRON ON THE BOAT, LIKE THAT THAT MADE ME FEEL SO AMERICAN. I WAS VERY PROUD TO BE FROM AMERICA AND SEEING ALL THE PEOPLE ON THE BOAT REPRESENTING OUR COUNTRY AND IT MAKES ME VERY PROUD.

ASHA BREEDLOVE,REPORTER:THE SPIRIT OF THE OLYMPICS IS INSPIRING TO MOST. NORMAL PEOPLE TRAINNG THIER HARDEST TO GET TO OLYMPIAN STATUS. PRE- COLLEGE STUDENT CHRISTINA LIGUORIA SAYS THAT IF SHE COULD SHE WOULD.

CHRISTINA LIGUORIA,INTERVIEWEE: I MEAN KIND OF YEAH. IF I WAS CAPABLE OF DOING LIKE FLIPS AND STUFF I’D DEFINITELY DO GYMNASTICS. I DON’T KNOW ITS SO COOL TO WATCH HOW GOOD THEY ARE. LIKE SIMONE BILES, INCREDIBLE.

ASHA BREEDLOVE,REPORTER:FROM CENTRAL NEW YORK TO THE CITY OF LOVE THE RED, WHITE AND BLUE, RUNS DEEP.

ASHA BREEDLOVE NCC NEWS.
